author: Kavita Upadhyay
text:
With the BJP at the Centre and the State practising “bigotry” by jailing dissenters and tagging them as “anti-national” while staying silent on the acts of their Ministers who go against the law, “it seems the country is entering a sad state”, activist and senior lawyer Prashant Bhushan said here on Saturday.

Mr. Bhushan was referring to BJP Ministers, including Rajasthan BJP MLA Kanwar Lal Meena, who attacked activists at Aklera in the State in January this year, and Union Minister of State for HRD, Ram Shankar Katheria, who allegedly made anti-Muslim statements in Agra recently.

Speaking about how students at the JNU were being targeted by the BJP, Mr. Bhushan said: “We are seeing a full-fledged fascist onslaught in the country and the [Central] government has openly come out in support of the fascist onslaught. Looking at how the BJP is deliberately targeting dissenters, the situation is turning out to be worse than Emergency. Over a month and a half after Meena beat up activists during a j awabdehi (accountability) yatra (in Rajasthan), he remains free. Then there are Ministers like Katheria, but no action is being taken against such people,” Mr. Bhushan said.
title: BJP governments practising bigotry, says Bhushan
